course.subject: MECH
course.name: Mechanisms of Machinery
course.description: Application of kinematics and dynamics in the analysis, design and synthesis of mechanisms. Type and dimensional design of linkages, cams and gears based on motion requirements and force transmission, in contrast to the strength requirements. Graphical, analytical and computer methods in analysis and design of mechanisms. Design considerations in mechanism synthesis.

reviews.author: Jacky 01
reviews.title: Quite difficult course
reviews.comment_content:
This course talks about mechanism, such as spur gear, four bar linkage, slider-crank mechanism, CAM etc. This course is very relevant to the mechanical engineering major. In this course, you need to do design, analysis of the velocity and acceleration of the parts/joints of the mechanism, and also mobility. The syllabus includes:

1. Joints
2. Simple linkage and mobility
3. Four bar linkage and mobility
4. Graphical method of analysis
5. Velocity images
6. The instant center of velocity
7. Computational analysis of four-bar linkages
8. Computational analysis of slider-crank linkages
9. Computational analysis of other linkages
Mid-term

10. Four-bar linkage design
11. Four-bar linkage motion design
12. Design of slider linkages
13. CAM –Introduction
14. CAM –Motion programming
15. CAM –Profile design
16. Spur gears–Introduction
17. Involute spur gears
18. Gear trains
19. Planetary gear trains

In my point of view, I think the part before the mid-term is way harder, the part after the mid-term is easier. In the graphical method, you need to draw lines using knowledge of vectors, and you need to draw it to the scale using rulers and protractor, and you get the result by measuring the length. It is a quite complicated work. But the worst nightmare is the computational part. You need to do very long derivation and a lot of math. The computational analysis of four bar linkage part is the most difficult part. I think this course is quite difficult and requires a lot of effort. It is even harder than some 4000-level mech course, such as Mech4360 which I took in the same semester. Also, this course requires you to use MATLAB, but they barely taught anything.

P.S. The section taught by professor Tang and Seo is very different, including the content and workload. I attend both of the section every weeks. I will talk more about it in "Teaching".
reviews.comment_teaching:
My section was Prof. Tang's section, but I also attend all of Prof. Seo's section. So I will talk both of them here.

For Prof. Tang's section:
He explain things very un-clear. He can't talk very fluently, and it is quite hard to get the concept. Also, he always jump between the slides frequently, which makes it even more hard to focus on what he says. But the worst part is right before the Final exam, we don't have time to teach all the contents, so he just let us self study for 60% of the contents. But at least he covered everything in the content, which is not the case in Prof. Seo's section,

For Prof. Seo's section:
He explain the basic concept quite clear. He don't use lecture notes in his lecture. Instead, he draw out everything on a white board, which explain better since this course is most about drawing graph, vectors. The lecture notes are also posted on Canvas for self-study. I thing his teaching is quite good BEFORE MID-TERM. After mid-term, everything changed, he didn't mention a lot of things that will be covered in the final exam. You need to do self-study for most of them. He even explain less than professor Tang after the mid-term. But the worst thing is, he didn't even give any homework and practice after the mid-term, so a lot of student do not know how to do the question.

The worst part of this course is that the two section's coverage don't match. Some of the content are taught by Prof Tang but not Prof Seo, and vice versa. They didn't even agree on the coverage on exam!!! Before final exam, Prof Tang said we won't cover bevel gear and things before the mid-term. But in the final exam, which I think the paper was made by Prof Seo, still ask about bevel gear and thing before the mid-term. And prof. Seo didn't give any homework about computational method, which is a huge part in the mid-term!!! That's why Prof. Tang said that his class's mean is way higher than the other section.

So, if you want to have a low workload, I suggest you to enroll to Prof. Seo's section. But if you want to have a good grade, I suggest you to enroll to Professor Tang's section while also sits Prof. Seo's section BEFORE MIDTERM!!!

For tutorial section, they explain things quite well, way better than lecture. Stanley will even give you some tips on drawing the graph by hand using compass in the exam, which is useful. So I strongly recommend you to attend every single tutorial section.
reviews.comment_grading:
Since the course content is quite hard, the mean is quite low as well. So the grading will not be harsh otherwise most of us will get C grade.
There are 10 homework, 1 Matlab homework, and 10 tutorial homework which counted as bonus marks. The weightings are:

Homework: 5%
Mid-term: 40%
Final exam: 45%
Matlab homework: 10%
Tutorial homework (Bonus): 15%

My grade:
Assignment overall: 77.11%
Tutorial assignment overall: 99.9%
Matlab homework: 65%
Mid-term: 62/100
Final exam: Un-released
Final grade: A-

Mean:
Assignment: 58.61%
Tutorial assignment: 67.956%
Matlab homework: 57.4%
Mid-term: 57.3%
Final exam: Un-released

As you can see, most of the mean are around 50-60%, which is quite low. The homework's mean is usually lower than 50% for most of the case. The tutorial assignment, however, is quite easy to do, and can earn bonus that has 3 times the marks of class assignment. So I strongly recommend you to do tutorial homework first even if you don't have time. You can give up homework since it has 10 homework but only takes up 5%. But you must do the tutorial assignment.

The Matlab homework, however, are a total nightmare. They require you to write a code to simulate four-bar linkage start from nothing. They barely taught anything about Matlab, it only has 2 50-mins tutorial about four-bar linkage. I finished it with help from a CS friend in Chinese University. I definitely cannot finish anything by my own. That's why mean is only 57.4%, I think a lot of people just cannot finish it. They are also 2 tutorial assignment need to use Matlab, but in this 2 assignments, they gave us the complete code, you just need to do some modifications, so it can be done even without programming background. But the Matlab homework are just depressing.

The final exam will not cover the content before the mid-term. But since the weighting of final and mid-term is very similar and has very large weighting, doing bad in mid-term exam will affect your grade a lot.

P.S. My professor are Professor Tang, which has 10 very difficult assignment that mean is always about 50%. But in professor Seo's section, they only has 3 assignment and are relative easy, which most of people can get high mark, which is so un-fair and is the worst part of this course's grading. I will talk more about it in "Workload".

P.P.S I actually retake this course. And from the 2 semester experience, Prof. Seo's exam paper is way harder than Prof. Tang. He will not ask questions that is straightforward. And sometimes he will ask things that only taught in his section. So if your mid-term exam is easy, you know the final will be hard.
reviews.comment_workload:
Extremely high if you are in professor Tang's section. We have totally 10 homework, which each one only has one week to do. And the questions are SUPER DIFFICULT!!! And what makes it worse is that it only cost 5%!!! 10 super difficult homework for just 5%!!! And you still have 10 tutorial homework every weeks!!! So average 2 homework each week. But those homework are good practice since the question in exams are difficult as well.

If you are in Prof. Seo's section, good for you, your workload is very low. You only has 3 homework, all of them are before mid-term. And the difficulty is way lower than Prof. Tang's section. You still need to do the tutorial homework, but they are easy. However, the homework given by Prof. Seo is far from enough to get a good grade in exams. The variety of question are small, and the difficulty is way too low compare to the exam. So you better to ask your friend in Prof. Tang's section to borrow their homework for you to practice.

The tutorial homework are quite easy to do. In fact they are just slight modification to the example question in the tutorial section. And you can use SolidWorks to draw graphs instead of using hands.

The Matlab homework, as I mentioned, are a total nightmare. You must do it early if you are a new learner of Matlab since you need to do a lot of self-study online and even ask some help from your friends. But collaboration is allowed, you just need to type in your collaborator's name the the code.

reviews.author: jc2048
reviews.title: Useful and interesting topic, but poor teaching
reviews.comment_content:
This course is about some basic and common mechanism, such as some basic linkages (hinges, sliders), CAM and gears. As a MECH student, the content of this course is highly related to my study.

Course contents:
- Joints, linkage and mobility
- 4-Bar linkage
- Position, velocity and acceleration analysis
- Instant center of velocity
- Computational analysis for linkages
- 4-Bar linkage design
- CAM motion and design
- Gear design and basic gear train
- Planetary gear trains

The overall content is not very difficult, however it requires a deeper understanding in order to solve questions
reviews.comment_teaching:
Professor Seo teaches this course poorly.

However, the tutorial sections by Dr. Stanley are completely different. Although his English is not as fluent, he explains the example questions very clearly for the session that I have attended.

Here are the points for why I think professor Seo teaches this course poorly:

1. This course uses online teaching, however sometimes the camera quality is low as $h1t and I cannot even distinguish the letter he wrote on the whiteboard.

2. Everyday he just draw on the whiteboard and explain stuff to us. Although drawing can give a better understanding to the course, he did not provide any notes to us about the drawings, only a few of them, and most of the contents require us to take screenshot of the zoom meeting, and you have to wait for the cloud recording if you are unfortunate and he erased that part just 1 minute after he drew it.

3. Prof only talks about the actual content of the course, and only explain the theory, without doing any actual examples together.

4. There are some part in the final exam, which are from the extra reading materials in Canvas, but he never talk about in the lectures.
reviews.comment_grading:
The mean of the exams are not very high, so it is not difficult to get an average grade.

My personal grade is not very good, so I will not post it here, please refer to others if you want to know more about grading.

Midterm 40%
Final 45%
Homework (3 + 1 programming homework) 15%
Tutorial Assignments (Extra credits) +15%
Total 115%
reviews.comment_workload:
Work load is supposed to be very low, since there are only 3 assignments and 1 programming assignments.

HOWEVER,

the first 3 assignment I completed them via googling for similar questions and learn the solving methods there and then complete the homework, which took me an extra 3+ hours to learn all the things again.

The programming homework is quite straightforward, just replace some of the variables and formulas in the MATLAB program you have created in the tutorial, but ONLY if you have created in the tutorial, because MATLAB skills are only being taught in tutorials.
